intro: Palicourea pseudaxillaris, commonly known as the false axilla. This species is a member of the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its opposite, simple leaves that are often elliptical to ovate in shape. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with four petals, typically white or pale pink, which are borne on short pedicels. Its fruits are small, fleshy berries that contain several seeds. Palicourea pseudaxillaris is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and is often found in humid, shaded environments.
